__e: I love how much you guys care about your patients.
There are the sad ones your clients dump on you, and those that make you feel better because someone's worse of than you.
Do you think it would be all right if I said a few words to your patients here?

I like to think that our patients choose our hospital not only because I leak rumours about competing hospitals to the press, but also because when they see one of our doctors, they think, "Now that's a professional."
It's one of our other patients.
Most of our patients have no family nearby.
They asked me to mingle with the patients, to go out to Occupational therapy.
And then signed up to work at a free clinic on Bergen Street... where she could spend more than 15 minutes per patient... and be the doctor she always wanted to be.
But that doesn't mean that I can't care for my patients or enjoy my job.
Most of the other patients are dead, aren't they?
I better get to work before all the good patients are taken.
Well, now the last of the invalids have gone, I suppose I'm finished.
Carla loves her patients. But she also loves how much they love her.
You doctors should have a way to tell a patient nothing's wrong so he's sure there's nothing wrong!
I know that she cares about the people she helps. - And she cares a lot.
Being a healthcare provider I try to be sympathetic towards my patients, but I have reached the end of my tether with you!
Nobody knows better than you, Richard. I can't discuss my patients.
- I would stay, but tell me who needs me? Since every one of my patients here will be going, too.
